title: Fragment, 13th century
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: two interconnected plain weave structures (lampas)
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 18.1 x 16.8 cm (7 1/8 x 6 5/8 in.)
description: The composition is divided into small squares in off-set rows, with a tile-like effect. The ground is white and the squares each contain a rosette or star in brilliant blue, green, red, and gold. Part of the Cope of San Valero, formerly in the Cathedral of Lérida, Spain.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fragment, 13th century.
13th century. Medium: silk
Technique: two interconnected plain weave structures (lampas). Gift of Anonymous Donor. 1938-78-1.
